result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan A. Brnak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan A. Brnak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan A. Brnak was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Ryan A. Brnak was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: For Cts 1 & 2 only - Dismissed.
Amended

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Case is resolved.  Amended information filed.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads no contest to counts 3 & 4; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 134 days KCJ each count concurrent.  Credit for time served.  Costs waived.  Appeal rights.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Defense requests another FPT in order to discuss the case with the assigned ADA (James Kraus).  FPT set for 9/15/14 @ 2:50pm.
Defendant's notice of hearing was returned, envelope states "return to sender not deliverable as addressed unable to forward" for address 1602 76 St, KW 53143.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Watson appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Arguments heard on deft's motion for bond reduction.  Deft's bond motion is denied for the reasons set forth on the record.
for a Bond Modification filed by Atty Kristyne Watson.  (Hearing 8/20/14 at 9:00.)
Jury Selection scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Speedy trial demand filed on 7/22/14.
filed by Aty Kristyne Watson

Defendant Ryan A. Brnak appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.  Matter set over w/co-def, Pignotti, 14CF517.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
5/16/14 - Preliminary Hearing/Arraignment (Filed in 14CF517)

130pm  Attorney Zach Wittchow appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: LE  Referred to Br.4 for further disposition on 7/16/14 @ 830am (FPT).  Information filed.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Bond continued.  kmk

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by the State. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing held with co-def. in 14CF517. KPD Officer Willie Hamilton sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Watson and co-def.'s Atty. David Celebre. Probable cause found. Information not filed. Arraignment on 5-22-14 @ 1:00pm. Judicial pretrial on 7-16-14 @ 8:30am with co-def. Bond continued.
Atty:  K Watson.
Filed by Atty:  K Watson.
